content:
I think Velvet does a great job of portraying the complex relationships between identity, social class, and power. The show effectively challenges traditional social hierarchies by highlighting the artificial nature of class divisions and encouraging empathy and understanding between characters from different backgrounds.

One aspect that I think is particularly well done is the way the show portrays the internalized oppression of the working class. The characters like Ana Ribera and her family have internalized the belief that they are inferior to the wealthy elite, and this affects their self-worth and aspirations. This is a powerful commentary on how societal expectations and norms can shape our sense of identity and limit our potential.

I also appreciate how the show explores the theme of social mobility and the difficulties of upward mobility for those from lower socioeconomic backgrounds. The character of Ana Ribera's rise to success is a great example of this, as she faces numerous obstacles and challenges along the way.

One area where I think the show could improve is in its portrayal of the wealthy elite. While
